newsArray.title: Thiago update, Darwin Nunez boost and three other things spotted in first day of Liverpool pre-season training
newsArray.description: Things we spotted from Liverpool's first training session of the season as Jurgen Klopp's men reported back for pre-season training
newsArray.content: Liverpool reported back to the AXA Training Centre for the start of pre-season training on Saturday, with eight senior players the first of Jurgen Klopp’s ranks to return. The club had already confirmed that Adrian, Stefan Bajcetic, Fabinho, Joe Gomez, Joel Matip, Darwin Nunez, Nathaniel Phillips and Thiago Alcantara would all report for duty this weekend, with the Reds’ internationals then getting their own schedules underway on Tuesday. Meanwhile, Curtis Jones and Harvey Elliott are due back later this summer after helping England reach the final of the Under-21s European Championships. As a result, summer signings Alexis Mac Allister and Dominik Szoboszlai will have to wait a little while longer to meet their new team-mates, courtesy of their summer international excursions with Argentina and Hungary respectively. But as the first players reported back for pre-season, here’s what we spotted in the first training pictures of the summer… While Thiago might have been on the eight-man list said to be reporting for pre-season training on Monday, the Spaniard was absent from Liverpool’s initial released training pictures amid speculation about his future. Although not pictured, it’s understood that the Reds’ players aren’t all in at the AXA Training Centre at the same time, with the Spaniard expected later today. While the 32-year-old wasn’t yet pictured, his seven other senior team-mates due back for pre-season on Saturday were. The midfielder has been subject of interest from Saudi Arabia and Turkey, but no clubs have approached the Reds as things stand. Meanwhile, Thiago missed the end of last season after undergoing surgery on a hip injury. As a result, it’s possible that was the reason behind him not being in at the same time as his team-mates. However, with speculation ongoing regarding his future, tongues are certain to be set wagging. While Thiago was absent, the other seven senior players scheduled to return were all pictured at the AXA Training Centre. As a result, Stefan Bajcetic made his own return from injury after missing the end of last season. The Spaniard enjoyed an impressive breakthrough campaign for Liverpool, making 19 appearances before an abductor injury curtailed his progress and ended his season prematurely back in March. But the 18-year-old was pictured lifting weights in the gym and kicking a ball around on the grass, suggesting he’s ready to hit the ground running this summer as he looks to make up for lost time. There was an extra senior player pictured in training on Saturday, with Calvin Ramay back at the AXA Training Centre despite it being confirmed he is spending the season out on loan. The Scotland international was confirmed to be joining Preston North End for the season last month, though the teenager isn’t set to link up with the Championship side until July 15. As a result, he’s starting pre-season with Liverpool. And having missed the end of last season with a knee injury which forced him to undergo surgery, the 19-year-old was spotted working hard in the gym and with a ball out on the pitch as, like Bajcetic, he looked to make up for lost time. Elsewhere, Academy goalkeeper Jakub Ojrzynski was also pictured in training after spending last season on loan with Radomiak Radom in his native Poland. Jurgen Klopp admitted Darwin Nunez hadn’t quite got the grasp of English on more than one occasion last season, but the Uruguayan was spotted on camera having a conversation with his manager, and pictured laughing and joking with the German. While just basic greetings, it would seem the striker has been working on his English over the summer. Nunez would also be pictured with Ramsay in the gym as the two exchanged greetings. Steady on, Darwin. Learning English is one thing, but you might not be ready for the young Scot’s broad Aberdeen accent just yet! It's been a long summer for the Liverpool squad, with 41 days passing since the Reds finished the season with a 4-4 draw away at Southampton. As a result, the players who reported back on Saturday were delighted to see each other. Joe Gomez was spotted giving both Klopp and Ramsay a big hug, (though he might not have had much say in the former!), while Fabinho and Adrian shared an embrace. Meanwhile, Joel Matip was spotted hugging assistant fitness coach Jordan Fairclough. Cute!

newsArray.title: David de Gea confirms Manchester United departure
newsArray.description: The 32-year-old’s contract with United expired at the end of June.
newsArray.content: The 32-year-old’s contract with United expired at the end of June, with no new deal agreed despite talks that took place throughout the season. In a message on social media, De Gea thanked United fans for their support, but said: “Now, it’s the right time to undertake a new challenge, to push myself again in new surroundings.” When De Gea’s contract expired last Friday, United said they remained in talks with the Spain goalkeeper. De Gea wrote: “I would like to express my unwavering gratitude and appreciation for the love from the last 12 years. We’ve achieved a lot since my dear Sir Alex Ferguson brought me to this club. “I took incredible pride every time I pulled on this shirt, to lead the team, to represent this institution, the biggest club in the world was an honour only bestows upon a few lucky footballers. “It’s been an unforgettable and successful period since I came here. The 32-year-old’s contract at Old Trafford expired at the end of June, with Mail Sport revealing last month that the framework for a new contract aimed at reducing De Gea's £375,000-a-week wage had initially been agreed between the player and the club. However, manager Erik Ten Hag's reservations over keeping his No 1 had put the deal in jeopardy, with the club backing out of the tabled offer. De Gea posted a circus emoji on Twitter this week , displaying in no uncertain terms his unhappiness with the club's actions, and now United have confirmed that the Spaniard's career at Old Trafford is over. Following an official statement from the club in which De Ge was thanked for his service, the 32-year-old posted his own statement on Twitter. He insists that he is 'seeking a new challenge', despite being blindsided by the contract withdrawal. 'I would like to express my unwavering gratitude and appreciation for the love from the last 12 years. We’ve achieved a lot since my dear Sir Alex Ferguson brought me to this club. 'Now, it’s the right time to undertake a new challenge, to push myself again in new surroundings. Manchester will always be in my heart, Manchester has shaped me and will never leave me. We’ve seen it all.' Ten Hag sent the goalkeeper his best wishes, despite having cold feet over the new contract. He said via the club's official website : 'It takes great quality and character to reach the level of even playing one game for Manchester United. To do it 545 times over 12 years is a special achievement, particularly in the goalkeeping position where every game puts you in the spotlight. De Gea was brought to the club by legendary former coach Sir Alex Ferguson in 2011 He won eight trophies during his time in Manchester, including the 2015-16 FA Cup (above) 'To have won Player of the Year awards from both the fans and his team-mates, each on four occasions, shows the level of his performance and he will always be remembered as one of the very best goalkeepers in the history of the club. 'I am personally grateful for the 25 clean sheets he helped provide last season and his overall contribution on the pitch during my first year at the club. All the players and staff send him our very best wishes for the next phase of his outstanding career.' De Gea's circus message was the latest in a series of snappy social media posts in recent weeks. At the end of June he posted a yawning emoji in what seemed to be another reference to his long-running contract saga. The Spaniard made 545 appearances for the Red Devils, keeping 190 clean sheets. He lifted eight trophies during his time at Old Trafford - including the Premier League, FA Cup and Europa League. United are now on the lookout for a new No 1 goalkeeper, with Ten Hag keen to land his former Ajax stopper Andre Onana in a £43million deal. newsArray.title: David De Gea transfer decision confirmed amid Jordan Pickford and Everton rumours
newsArray.description: David de Gea has bid farewell to Manchester United fans following the expiry of his contract
newsArray.content: David de Gea has confirmed he will not be extending his stay at Manchester United amid claims the Red Devils are targeting Everton's Jordan Pickford. The Spaniard's 12-year association with the Old Trafford club comes to an end after his contract expired at the end of July. It was claimed that United were looking to continue dialogue with the goalkeeper following the end of his deal with a view to extending on reduced terms. However, the shot-stopper has confirmed that he is now a free agent. In recent days, the 32-year-old has posted a series of tweets which appear cryptic to describe the situation that is unravelling in Manchester. The Manchester Evening News reported previously in May that there were with . In a post on Twitter, De Gea confirmed his exit, writing: "I just wanted to send this farewell message to all Manchester United supporters. "I would like to express my unwavering gratitude and appreciation for the love from the last 12 years. We’ve achieved a lot since my dear Sir Alex Ferguson brought me to this club. I took incredible pride everytime I pulled on this shirt, to lead the team, to represent this institution, the biggest club in the world was an honour only bestows upon a few lucky footballers. "It’s been an unforgettable and successful period since I came here. I didn’t think from leaving Madrid as a young boy we would achieve what we did together. "Now, it’s the right time to undertake a new challenge, to push myself again in new surroundings. Manchester will always be in my heart, Manchester has shaped me and will never leave me. We’ve seen it all." With speculation surrounding their next goalkeeper, 's was subject to reported interest from the Red Devils. In recent months, the attention of Erik ten Hag has turned to Inter Milan's Andre Onana - after the pair's time together at Ajax. Talks have also been held with the agent of Urawa Red Diamonds and Japan Under-21 goalie Zion Suzuki over a possible second addition between the sticks.

newsArray.content: Kylian Mbappe slams 'divisive' PSG and questions their signings in explosive interview... as 'six of the club's angry players complain to president Nasser Al-Khelaifi about the French star's comments' Six PSG players have complained about Kylian Mbappe's controversial interview Mbappe claims his performances are criticised due to the divisive nature of PSG Follow MailSport on Threads here: https://www.threads.net/@mailsport By George Glinski For Mailonline Published: 14:33 BST, 8 July 2023 | Updated: 15:03 BST, 8 July 2023 e-mail 27 View comments Six PSG players have contacted club president Nasser Al-Khelaifi to complain about comment's made by Kylian Mbappe during a recent interview with France Football Magazine. According to Sky Sports , two of the six are players that have joined this summer. Mbappe spoke to the publication on June 12 but the article has only just been published. During the sit down, he branded PSG as a 'divisive' club and stated that his performances are unjustly criticised because it is much harder to impress while playing in France. 'Are people trivializing my performances?' he told France Football. 'Yes, but at the same time, I don't blame them, he says. In France, they saw me grow up, they see me all the time, at PSG every weekends or in selection. Kylian Mbappe slammed PSG and Ligue 1 during a controversial interview with France Football Mbappe's contract runs out at PSG in June 2024 and he looks set to leave the club this summer Naseer Al-Khelaifi has received six complaints from PSG players about Mbappe's interview 'And I've been scoring a lot for years. So, for people, it's becoming normal. I've never complained that my performances are trivialized. 'I'm young and I've had the chance to It was not that long ago to be an observer, before being an actor. 'And myself, I trivialized what Messi was doing, what Cristiano Ronaldo was doing, what the great players were doing. We are in a consumer society, where "it's good, but do again". 'And the fact that I'm right next door, in Paris... I think playing at Paris-SG doesn't help much because it's a divisive team, a divisive club. 'So, of course it attracts gossip but it doesn't bother me because I know what I'm doing and how I do it.' Mbappe recently sent a letter to PSG affirming that he has no intention of extending his contract with the club by a further year, which expires in 2024, but it is unclear whether he is aiming to see out his deal at Princes Park or move elsewhere this summer. The French giants are keen to cash in on their star man if he chooses to leave and have given him a deadline of July 31 to make a decision about his future. newsArray.title: ‘One of the greatest strikers in the world’: Pochettino praises Chelsea transfer target and it’s not Mbappe or Haaland
newsArray.description: Mauricio Pochettino hailed a Chelsea transfer target, but played down talks of the club signing the forward.
newsArray.content: Mauricio Pochettino was unveiled as the new head coach for Chelsea on Friday, and spoke to the press about what his ambitions are for the summer transfer window and the season that lies ahead. Pochettino joins a Chelsea team which experienced a very poor 2022/23 season, finishing in 12th place in the Premier League, despite upwards of 600 million pounds spent by new owner Todd Boehly and his consortium. Newly-appointed Chelsea manager Mauricio Pochettino addresses the media during a press conference.(AP) Pochettino has been without a club since his departure from PSG, but returns to the city where he earned his name as one of the finest young managers in European football. Formerly having been head coach at Tottenham Hotspur, the Argentinian oversaw their most successful years of the 21st century. He took them to numerous top 3 finishes and a Champions League final, but perhaps most importantly oversaw the development of Harry Kane. Also Read | Inter Miami announce 'The Unveil' ahead of Messi arrival With Kane’s contract entering its final year and the English striker seeking a new club, there have been rumours linking him to a reunion with his former boss, heading across London to play at Stamford Bridge. However, Pochettino held his cards close to his chest regarding a potential transfer for one of the PL’s highest ever scorers. “You are talking about one of the greatest strikers in the world,” said Pochettino in his first interview as Chelsea manager. “I think it’s too unfair to talk (about a player at another club).” Kane overtook Wayne Rooney in the list of the Premier League’s all-time top-scorers, and now sits behind only Alan Shearer. He was heavily linked with Manchester United earlier this window, but the Red Devils have reportedly pulled out of the pursuit. “They know my relationship with him was always amazing. I saw him when he was young and grow up and achieve all that he was achieving. We have a great relationship,” said Pochettino of his bond with Kane. Kane came through at Spurs under Pochettino and twice won the golden boot under him. He scored 29 goals in 30 appearances in the 2016/17 season, the closest Kane and Pochettino came to winning the league, falling narrowly short of Pochettino’s new employers that season. Kane is also heavily being linked with Bayern Munich, but might potentially want to stay in England. He sits 47 goals short of Shearer’s record, and still only 29 years old, could establish himself as the Premier League’s most prolific striker in due time. His stellar season this year paled in comparison to Erling Haaland’s incredible numbers, but 30 goals for 8th-place Tottenham is nonetheless a remarkable feat. Chelsea are going through significant changes this window, offloading some of their old guard in favour of fresh faces. Kai Havertz, Mason Mount, Matteo Kovacic, Ngolo Kante, and Hakim Ziyech have all left the club. Meanwhile, Christopher Nkunku and Nicolas Jackson join from RB Leipzig and Villareal respectively. Chelsea are still looking to add firepower to a team which scored only 38 goals last season: only four teams in the Premier League scored fewer. “At the moment, we are thinking (in the transfer market) in a different way. We are not thinking that. We’re working hard to try to provide the squad with good quality. We are working on that and still we have time to work. For sure we are going to add players that can score and we are going to find the best way to play,” concluded Pochettino. Pochettino and Chelsea begin their preseason preparations in the United States, starting with a friendly against the Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney-owned Wrexham. newsArray.title: Kyle Walker 'is still undecided on his Man City future' despite being offered a new contract
newsArray.description: Kyle Walker will make a decision on his future 'very soon' amid speculation over his role at Man City next season.
newsArray.content: Kyle Walker 'is still undecided on his Man City future' despite being offered a new contract, with Bayern Munich boss Thomas Tuchel 'pushing to sign him this summer' England's Kyle Walker has enjoyed an illustrious six years at Manchester City He 'remains undecided on his future' amid interest from Bayern Munich Follow MailSport on Threads here: https://www.threads.net/@mailsport By Michael Rudling For Mailonlne Published: 08:38 EDT, 8 July 2023 | Updated: 09:10 EDT, 8 July 2023 e-mail View comments Kyle Walker will make a decision on his future 'very soon' amid speculation over his role at Man City next season. The 33-year-old has enjoyed an extraordinary six seasons at the Etihad, winning five Premier League titles and the Champions League. He played 39 games for City as they secured a historic treble in 2022/23 but was occasionally dropped for big games, including the the UCL final. Walker later admitted the decision left him 'gutted'. The England fullback remains undecided on where he will play his football next season, with Fabrizio Romano reporting that he has not yet accepted a new contract offered by Man City. He also claims that Bayern remain keen on Walker, with manager Thomas Tuchel a big admirer. Manchester City and England fullback Kyle Walker 'remains undecided on his future' Man City have offered him a new deal, but Bayern Munich remain interested Follow MailSport on Threads here: https://www.threads.net/@mailsport Mail Sport also previously reported that Sheffield United were keen on bringing Walker to Yorkshire , though a move to Munich would allow him to keep playing Champions League football next season. The Blades are Walker's hometown club, and would be willing to welcome him back following his exit in 2009, as they adjust to their first season back in the Premier League. Wherever he ends up playing, the Man City man will be in good shape after he was pictured out for a run near his home in Cheshire just two weeks after playing his final game of the season with England. He was pictured with former Spurs, Sheffield United and City midfielder Michael Brown as they pounded around the streets. City have already been active elsewhere in the transfer market, with Mateo Kovacic arriving from Chelsea for £25 million. The former Real Madrid man will fill the gap left by Ilkay Gundogan, who has joined Barcelona on a free transfer. They had also been heavily linked with Declan Rice, but pulled out of negotiations for the midfielder. He is expected to join Arsenal for £105m in the coming days. newsArray.title: Thiago update, Darwin Nunez boost and three other things spotted in first day of Liverpool pre-season training
newsArray.description: Things we spotted from Liverpool's first training session of the season as Jurgen Klopp's men reported back for pre-season training
newsArray.content: Liverpool reported back to the AXA Training Centre for the start of pre-season training on Saturday, with eight senior players the first of Jurgen Klopp’s ranks to return. The club had already confirmed that Adrian, Stefan Bajcetic, Fabinho, Joe Gomez, Joel Matip, Darwin Nunez, Nathaniel Phillips and Thiago Alcantara would all report for duty this weekend, with the Reds’ internationals then getting their own schedules underway on Tuesday. Meanwhile, Curtis Jones and Harvey Elliott are due back later this summer after helping England reach the final of the Under-21s European Championships. As a result, summer signings Alexis Mac Allister and Dominik Szoboszlai will have to wait a little while longer to meet their new team-mates, courtesy of their summer international excursions with Argentina and Hungary respectively. But as the first players reported back for pre-season, here’s what we spotted in the first training pictures of the summer… While Thiago might have been on the eight-man list said to be reporting for pre-season training on Monday, the Spaniard was absent from Liverpool’s initial released training pictures amid speculation about his future. Although not pictured, it’s understood that the Reds’ players aren’t all in at the AXA Training Centre at the same time, with the Spaniard expected later today. While the 32-year-old wasn’t yet pictured, his seven other senior team-mates due back for pre-season on Saturday were. The midfielder has been subject of interest from Saudi Arabia and Turkey, but no clubs have approached the Reds as things stand. Meanwhile, Thiago missed the end of last season after undergoing surgery on a hip injury. As a result, it’s possible that was the reason behind him not being in at the same time as his team-mates. However, with speculation ongoing regarding his future, tongues are certain to be set wagging. While Thiago was absent, the other seven senior players scheduled to return were all pictured at the AXA Training Centre. As a result, Stefan Bajcetic made his own return from injury after missing the end of last season. The Spaniard enjoyed an impressive breakthrough campaign for Liverpool, making 19 appearances before an abductor injury curtailed his progress and ended his season prematurely back in March. But the 18-year-old was pictured lifting weights in the gym and kicking a ball around on the grass, suggesting he’s ready to hit the ground running this summer as he looks to make up for lost time. There was an extra senior player pictured in training on Saturday, with Calvin Ramay back at the AXA Training Centre despite it being confirmed he is spending the season out on loan. The Scotland international was confirmed to be joining Preston North End for the season last month, though the teenager isn’t set to link up with the Championship side until July 15. As a result, he’s starting pre-season with Liverpool. And having missed the end of last season with a knee injury which forced him to undergo surgery, the 19-year-old was spotted working hard in the gym and with a ball out on the pitch as, like Bajcetic, he looked to make up for lost time. Elsewhere, Academy goalkeeper Jakub Ojrzynski was also pictured in training after spending last season on loan with Radomiak Radom in his native Poland. Jurgen Klopp admitted Darwin Nunez hadn’t quite got the grasp of English on more than one occasion last season, but the Uruguayan was spotted on camera having a conversation with his manager, and pictured laughing and joking with the German. While just basic greetings, it would seem the striker has been working on his English over the summer. Nunez would also be pictured with Ramsay in the gym as the two exchanged greetings. Steady on, Darwin. Learning English is one thing, but you might not be ready for the young Scot’s broad Aberdeen accent just yet! It's been a long summer for the Liverpool squad, with 41 days passing since the Reds finished the season with a 4-4 draw away at Southampton. As a result, the players who reported back on Saturday were delighted to see each other. Joe Gomez was spotted giving both Klopp and Ramsay a big hug, (though he might not have had much say in the former!), while Fabinho and Adrian shared an embrace. Meanwhile, Joel Matip was spotted hugging assistant fitness coach Jordan Fairclough. Cute!

newsArray.title: ‘One of the greatest strikers in the world’: Pochettino praises Chelsea transfer target and it’s not Mbappe or Haaland
newsArray.description: Mauricio Pochettino hailed a Chelsea transfer target, but played down talks of the club signing the forward.
newsArray.content: Mauricio Pochettino was unveiled as the new head coach for Chelsea on Friday, and spoke to the press about what his ambitions are for the summer transfer window and the season that lies ahead. Pochettino joins a Chelsea team which experienced a very poor 2022/23 season, finishing in 12th place in the Premier League, despite upwards of 600 million pounds spent by new owner Todd Boehly and his consortium. Newly-appointed Chelsea manager Mauricio Pochettino addresses the media during a press conference.(AP) Pochettino has been without a club since his departure from PSG, but returns to the city where he earned his name as one of the finest young managers in European football. Formerly having been head coach at Tottenham Hotspur, the Argentinian oversaw their most successful years of the 21st century. He took them to numerous top 3 finishes and a Champions League final, but perhaps most importantly oversaw the development of Harry Kane. Also Read | Inter Miami announce 'The Unveil' ahead of Messi arrival With Kane’s contract entering its final year and the English striker seeking a new club, there have been rumours linking him to a reunion with his former boss, heading across London to play at Stamford Bridge. However, Pochettino held his cards close to his chest regarding a potential transfer for one of the PL’s highest ever scorers. “You are talking about one of the greatest strikers in the world,” said Pochettino in his first interview as Chelsea manager. “I think it’s too unfair to talk (about a player at another club).” Kane overtook Wayne Rooney in the list of the Premier League’s all-time top-scorers, and now sits behind only Alan Shearer. He was heavily linked with Manchester United earlier this window, but the Red Devils have reportedly pulled out of the pursuit. “They know my relationship with him was always amazing. I saw him when he was young and grow up and achieve all that he was achieving. We have a great relationship,” said Pochettino of his bond with Kane. Kane came through at Spurs under Pochettino and twice won the golden boot under him. He scored 29 goals in 30 appearances in the 2016/17 season, the closest Kane and Pochettino came to winning the league, falling narrowly short of Pochettino’s new employers that season. Kane is also heavily being linked with Bayern Munich, but might potentially want to stay in England. He sits 47 goals short of Shearer’s record, and still only 29 years old, could establish himself as the Premier League’s most prolific striker in due time. His stellar season this year paled in comparison to Erling Haaland’s incredible numbers, but 30 goals for 8th-place Tottenham is nonetheless a remarkable feat. Chelsea are going through significant changes this window, offloading some of their old guard in favour of fresh faces. Kai Havertz, Mason Mount, Matteo Kovacic, Ngolo Kante, and Hakim Ziyech have all left the club. Meanwhile, Christopher Nkunku and Nicolas Jackson join from RB Leipzig and Villareal respectively. Chelsea are still looking to add firepower to a team which scored only 38 goals last season: only four teams in the Premier League scored fewer. “At the moment, we are thinking (in the transfer market) in a different way. We are not thinking that. We’re working hard to try to provide the squad with good quality. We are working on that and still we have time to work. For sure we are going to add players that can score and we are going to find the best way to play,” concluded Pochettino. Pochettino and Chelsea begin their preseason preparations in the United States, starting with a friendly against the Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney-owned Wrexham. newsArray.title: Thiago update, Darwin Nunez boost and three other things spotted in first day of Liverpool pre-season training
newsArray.description: Things we spotted from Liverpool's first training session of the season as Jurgen Klopp's men reported back for pre-season training
newsArray.content: Liverpool reported back to the AXA Training Centre for the start of pre-season training on Saturday, with eight senior players the first of Jurgen Klopp’s ranks to return. The club had already confirmed that Adrian, Stefan Bajcetic, Fabinho, Joe Gomez, Joel Matip, Darwin Nunez, Nathaniel Phillips and Thiago Alcantara would all report for duty this weekend, with the Reds’ internationals then getting their own schedules underway on Tuesday. Meanwhile, Curtis Jones and Harvey Elliott are due back later this summer after helping England reach the final of the Under-21s European Championships. As a result, summer signings Alexis Mac Allister and Dominik Szoboszlai will have to wait a little while longer to meet their new team-mates, courtesy of their summer international excursions with Argentina and Hungary respectively. But as the first players reported back for pre-season, here’s what we spotted in the first training pictures of the summer… While Thiago might have been on the eight-man list said to be reporting for pre-season training on Monday, the Spaniard was absent from Liverpool’s initial released training pictures amid speculation about his future. Although not pictured, it’s understood that the Reds’ players aren’t all in at the AXA Training Centre at the same time, with the Spaniard expected later today. While the 32-year-old wasn’t yet pictured, his seven other senior team-mates due back for pre-season on Saturday were. The midfielder has been subject of interest from Saudi Arabia and Turkey, but no clubs have approached the Reds as things stand. Meanwhile, Thiago missed the end of last season after undergoing surgery on a hip injury. As a result, it’s possible that was the reason behind him not being in at the same time as his team-mates. However, with speculation ongoing regarding his future, tongues are certain to be set wagging. While Thiago was absent, the other seven senior players scheduled to return were all pictured at the AXA Training Centre. As a result, Stefan Bajcetic made his own return from injury after missing the end of last season. The Spaniard enjoyed an impressive breakthrough campaign for Liverpool, making 19 appearances before an abductor injury curtailed his progress and ended his season prematurely back in March. But the 18-year-old was pictured lifting weights in the gym and kicking a ball around on the grass, suggesting he’s ready to hit the ground running this summer as he looks to make up for lost time. There was an extra senior player pictured in training on Saturday, with Calvin Ramay back at the AXA Training Centre despite it being confirmed he is spending the season out on loan. The Scotland international was confirmed to be joining Preston North End for the season last month, though the teenager isn’t set to link up with the Championship side until July 15. As a result, he’s starting pre-season with Liverpool. And having missed the end of last season with a knee injury which forced him to undergo surgery, the 19-year-old was spotted working hard in the gym and with a ball out on the pitch as, like Bajcetic, he looked to make up for lost time. Elsewhere, Academy goalkeeper Jakub Ojrzynski was also pictured in training after spending last season on loan with Radomiak Radom in his native Poland. Jurgen Klopp admitted Darwin Nunez hadn’t quite got the grasp of English on more than one occasion last season, but the Uruguayan was spotted on camera having a conversation with his manager, and pictured laughing and joking with the German. While just basic greetings, it would seem the striker has been working on his English over the summer. Nunez would also be pictured with Ramsay in the gym as the two exchanged greetings. Steady on, Darwin. Learning English is one thing, but you might not be ready for the young Scot’s broad Aberdeen accent just yet! It's been a long summer for the Liverpool squad, with 41 days passing since the Reds finished the season with a 4-4 draw away at Southampton. As a result, the players who reported back on Saturday were delighted to see each other. Joe Gomez was spotted giving both Klopp and Ramsay a big hug, (though he might not have had much say in the former!), while Fabinho and Adrian shared an embrace. Meanwhile, Joel Matip was spotted hugging assistant fitness coach Jordan Fairclough. Cute!

newsArray.title: ‘One of the greatest strikers in the world’: Pochettino praises Chelsea transfer target and it’s not Mbappe or Haaland
newsArray.description: Mauricio Pochettino hailed a Chelsea transfer target, but played down talks of the club signing the forward.
newsArray.content: Mauricio Pochettino was unveiled as the new head coach for Chelsea on Friday, and spoke to the press about what his ambitions are for the summer transfer window and the season that lies ahead. Pochettino joins a Chelsea team which experienced a very poor 2022/23 season, finishing in 12th place in the Premier League, despite upwards of 600 million pounds spent by new owner Todd Boehly and his consortium. Newly-appointed Chelsea manager Mauricio Pochettino addresses the media during a press conference.(AP) Pochettino has been without a club since his departure from PSG, but returns to the city where he earned his name as one of the finest young managers in European football. Formerly having been head coach at Tottenham Hotspur, the Argentinian oversaw their most successful years of the 21st century. He took them to numerous top 3 finishes and a Champions League final, but perhaps most importantly oversaw the development of Harry Kane. Also Read | Inter Miami announce 'The Unveil' ahead of Messi arrival With Kane’s contract entering its final year and the English striker seeking a new club, there have been rumours linking him to a reunion with his former boss, heading across London to play at Stamford Bridge. However, Pochettino held his cards close to his chest regarding a potential transfer for one of the PL’s highest ever scorers. “You are talking about one of the greatest strikers in the world,” said Pochettino in his first interview as Chelsea manager. “I think it’s too unfair to talk (about a player at another club).” Kane overtook Wayne Rooney in the list of the Premier League’s all-time top-scorers, and now sits behind only Alan Shearer. He was heavily linked with Manchester United earlier this window, but the Red Devils have reportedly pulled out of the pursuit. “They know my relationship with him was always amazing. I saw him when he was young and grow up and achieve all that he was achieving. We have a great relationship,” said Pochettino of his bond with Kane. Kane came through at Spurs under Pochettino and twice won the golden boot under him. He scored 29 goals in 30 appearances in the 2016/17 season, the closest Kane and Pochettino came to winning the league, falling narrowly short of Pochettino’s new employers that season. Kane is also heavily being linked with Bayern Munich, but might potentially want to stay in England. He sits 47 goals short of Shearer’s record, and still only 29 years old, could establish himself as the Premier League’s most prolific striker in due time. His stellar season this year paled in comparison to Erling Haaland’s incredible numbers, but 30 goals for 8th-place Tottenham is nonetheless a remarkable feat. Chelsea are going through significant changes this window, offloading some of their old guard in favour of fresh faces. Kai Havertz, Mason Mount, Matteo Kovacic, Ngolo Kante, and Hakim Ziyech have all left the club. Meanwhile, Christopher Nkunku and Nicolas Jackson join from RB Leipzig and Villareal respectively. Chelsea are still looking to add firepower to a team which scored only 38 goals last season: only four teams in the Premier League scored fewer. “At the moment, we are thinking (in the transfer market) in a different way. We are not thinking that. We’re working hard to try to provide the squad with good quality. We are working on that and still we have time to work. For sure we are going to add players that can score and we are going to find the best way to play,” concluded Pochettino. Pochettino and Chelsea begin their preseason preparations in the United States, starting with a friendly against the Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney-owned Wrexham. The Blades are Walker's hometown club, and would be willing to welcome him back following his exit in 2009, as they adjust to their first season back in the Premier League. Wherever he ends up playing, the Man City man will be in good shape after he was pictured out for a run near his home in Cheshire just two weeks after playing his final game of the season with England. He was pictured with former Spurs, Sheffield United and City midfielder Michael Brown as they pounded around the streets. City have already been active elsewhere in the transfer market, with Mateo Kovacic arriving from Chelsea for £25 million. The former Real Madrid man will fill the gap left by Ilkay Gundogan, who has joined Barcelona on a free transfer. They had also been heavily linked with Declan Rice, but pulled out of negotiations for the midfielder. He is expected to join Arsenal for £105m in the coming days. newsArray.content: Liverpool's pre-season is underway as Jurgen Klopp gets ready to welcome back a host of first teamers to Kirkby. It's been an exciting off season so far for the Reds with the acquisitions of and but now all attention will be on getting Liverpool into top condition as they look to break back into the top four next season. Klopp's men now have five matches announced as they make their bid for full fitness. Eight members of Klopp’s senior squad are set to return for day one of pre-season including Adrian, Stefan Bajcetic, Fabinho, Joe Gomez, Joel Matip, Darwin Nunez, Nathaniel Phillips and Thiago Alcantara. Harvey Elliott and Curtis Jones will join up at a later date following their successful stint with England in the . First up are games against Karlsruher SC and Greuther Furth in Germany. They will then entertain Leicester City and Bayern Munich as part of their Singapore tour, before returning to the UK to meet SV Darmstadt 98 at Preston North End's Deepdale stadium. The games are expected to feature a number of senior players with the Liverpool players who have been on international duty during the summer set to get their schedule under way on Tuesday, July 11. You'll be able to watch all five of the Reds' fixtures live and on demand this summer with LFCTV GO, including the games in Germany and Singapore, as well as the Darmstadt game at Deepdale.
